body: Can one of the admins verify this patch?

Can one of the admins verify this patch?

@jcanizales: Any feedback on this PR or the approach?  Happy to go a different direction, but the `forHost` is the only pattern used right now in the Objective C code setting authentication or connection level settings.
Sorry for the delay, Paul! Lately I've been almost 100% focused on fixing https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/4064. I'll review your PR today for sure.
The overall design looks good to me. I'm going to go ahead and add inline comments about specifics.
Also - let me know if you're able to run the tests with Cocoapods 0.39. If you rather not downgrade your installed version, I'm happy to fetch the branch and run the tests on my machine.

Actually, let me ask you a general question if you don't mind. So far, the only use case I've heard of for wanting to set a private key on an iOS app was for a demo app that wouldn't be distributed. The moment an app with an embedded private key is distributed, the key stops being a secret and the purpose is defeated. So what is the use case you have in mind here?
There are issues of style conformance here and there, but let's leave that for the end.

@jcanizales Use case:
- For setting a Client Certificate aka **Mutual TLS Authentication**: I'm working on a Mac App. We do not ship a client certificate & private key with the application distribution.  We have two use cases in our Mac app:
  - **gRPC to Helper**: We have a Go based helper that contains portable business logic -- we are wrapping it in native UIs for each OS, eg a native Mac App (ObjectiveC/Swift), a native Windows app (C#).  In this case, on startup, the Helper app gives our Mac App a CA, certificate, and private key it has generated, and operates an HTTPS service on 127.0.0.1 and the Mac App calls to this service.  This is our use case today.
  - **gRPC to Remote Service**:  [The product I work on](https://www.scaleft.com/products/access/) is a Certificate Authority which issues ephemeral short lived client certiciates based on multiple factors for use in authenticating to remote services.  I believe in general there are many ways a user can get a client certificate & private key that is not distributed with an application, and having a way to configure this brings the Objective C API to parity with the other gRPC languages: http://www.grpc.io/docs/guides/auth.html#ssl-tls
- For `setSslPemRootCerts`: Common use case of setting your own trusted Certificate Authorities.  Various reasons that a CA is either not in the Mozilla/CAB list, or it is an internal corporate CA.  This use case exist on iOS or Mac IMO, and is safe/common to bundle with your shipping application.
style conformance: Is there a `clang-format` params I should use?   The `./tools/distrib/clang_format_code.sh` script doesn't include `.m` in its file types to format?

Thanks for describing your use cases; it's very useful to me. To make sure I understood it correctly:
1. Mac app asks Go helper "please produce a key and cert for this end user",
2. Go helper creates it and sends it back to the Mac app,
3. The Mac app uses it (or a personal key+cert the user already had) to communicate with your remote server.

In no case the intention of the certificate is to try to identify the client app, rather the end user, correct?

For style conformance we don't have an automated tool yet I'm afraid :disappointed:  We mostly follow [Google's ObjC style guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/objcguide.xml). @makdharma and I were talking the other day about adding at least a linter (and in an ideal world an auto-formatter). I've just filed https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/5703 to track.

> In no case the intention of the certificate is to try to identify the client app, rather the end user, correct?

Correct, only using client certificates & private keys to identify the user or session, not a whole application.

@jcanizales Updated patch to orient around a reused `channelCreds` property on `GRPCHost`.  Also changed the external interface to have just two functions: 
- `[GRPCCall setSSLCredentials: ...]` for setting a client certificate and private key, and optionally the trusted CA list.
- `[GRPCCall setSSLPEMRootCerts:...]` for the use case of just overriding the root CAs.

Which I believe better reflect the common use cases and calling patterns (either setting everything, or just setting the trusted CA List)
Hi Paul, I'm happy with the new design so I went ahead and added inline suggestions for the implementation. It looks great overall! Just a few things to comment.

@jcanizales: rebased to master and changed method names to `setTLS` instead of `setSSL`.

PR now includes https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/5737 and https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/5736 so that I can compile/test it, but submited them as separate PRs as they are both 1-2 liners.
fixed & updated rebased so #5737 isn't there.
this is ok to test
Ah, and the copyright year in `GRPCCall+Tests.m` needs to be changed to `2015-2016` for the tool not to complain.
I'd love to see this get merged. Anything I can do to help?

Hi Matt. Paul disappeared for a while, so you can help indeed. I guess the easiest way forward is to copy his branch to your repo and sent it as a PR? There we can make these fixes:
- [Copyright fix](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/5592#issuecomment-198777630) for the tests not to complain.
- s/SSL/TLS everywhere (I think there's only a comment with SSL left)
- [Method and parameter rename](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/5592#discussion_r56754239) for consistency and to follow Apple's acronym conventions.

And we should be good to merge it!
I'm happy to update the PR.  Just been focused on other parts of our project, since we have just been vendoring gRPC.

@pquerna Sure, if you have time to work on it, that's great. It sounds like there's not that much left to do. Or if not, I'd be happy to help out too (probably with less efficiency, but help nonetheless).
@jboeuf what would be the best way to test this? I don't see an easy map to any of the tests in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/interop-test-descriptions.md

@yang-g, @ctiller, @jtattermusch 
I think that we should add interop tests for SSL client certs. Who is the right person to talk to about this?
Friendly ping @pquerna :)
Apologies; I don't think I'll be able to get to this for 2-3 weeks, being tied up with other stuff;  CC @mgadda

When rebasing this to master, I had a linker error from `grpc_global_wakeup_fd`:

```
duplicate symbol _grpc_global_wakeup_fd in:
    Build/Products/Debug/gRPC/libgRPC.a(ev_posix.o)
    /Build/Products/Debug/gRPC/libgRPC.a(ev_poll_and_epoll_posix.o)
ld: 1 duplicate symbol for architecture x86_64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
```

So, simplest fix was to remove the duplicated grpc_global_wakeup_fd from `ev_posix.c` in 1b9c0a2123bc8e2e3c4a6a7b35e22a7b2b17a69f
